intro: Discocalyx micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered discocarp, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
